chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
He regularly read the Rule of Saint Benedict. While going through various books, he came across this rule. As he skimmed through it, he stumbled upon the passage that commands monks to sleep fully clothed. Rule of Saint Benedict, chapter twenty-two

Not fully understanding its meaning, he lay clothed for three years. Although he wasn't yet a monk, he embraced the gentle yoke of monastic life. He was diligent in following the saint's commandments and aspired to imitate another's way of life.

At that time, the Lord Jesus was planting simple seeds in barren land, foreseeing a hundredfold harvest.
chunks.original_latin:
S. Benedicti Regulam lectitat. 15. Contigit interea dum diversorum librorum
legeret volumina, ad beati Benedicti pervenisse
regulam: et cursim eam cum vellet transire, impegit
in eumdem locum, in quo praeceptum est monachis,
ut dormire debeant vestiti (Reg. S. Bened.,
cap. 22); nam plane non intelligens eumdem sensum,
per triennium jacuit vestitus, et necdum monachus,
monachorum lene ferebat jugum. Istius sancti
praecepta curabat obaudire, alterius vitam imitari
cupiebat. Jaciebat enim tunc Dominus Jesus in rudi
terra simplicia semina, ex qua providebat centuplicata
recipere frumenta.
